# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "YYYYMM")
end
```

This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame `df` as input. It creates a new column `ym` by using the `Dates.format` function to convert each DateTime value in the `dt` column into a string in the format "yyyymm". The resulting strings are then assigned to the `ym` column in the DataFrame.
